      • isUseProxyChain

        public boolean isUseProxyChain()
        Tells whether or not the outgoing connections should use the proxy set.
        Returns:
        true if outgoing connections should use the proxy set, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.3.0
        See Also:
        setUseProxyChain(boolean)

      • setUseProxyChain

        public void setUseProxyChain(boolean useProxyChain)
        Sets whether or not the outgoing connections should use the proxy set.

        Note: The call to this method has no effect if set to use the proxy but the proxy was not previously configured.

        Parameters:
        useProxyChain - true if outgoing connections should use the proxy set, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.3.0
        See Also:
        isUseProxyChain(), setProxyChainName(String), setProxyChainPort(int)

      • getProxyChainName

        public String getProxyChainName()
        Returns the name of the outgoing proxy. The returned name is never null.
        Returns:
        the name of the outgoing proxy, never null.
        See Also:
        isUseProxyChain(), setProxyChainName(String)

      • setProxyChainName

        public void setProxyChainName(String proxyChainName)
        Sets the name of the outgoing proxy. If empty the use of the outgoing proxy will be disabled.

        Note: The call to this method has no effect if the given proxyChainName is null.

        Parameters:
        proxyChainName - the name of the outgoing proxy
        See Also:
        getProxyChainName(), setUseProxyChain(boolean)

      • getProxyChainPort

        public int getProxyChainPort()

        @Deprecated
public String getProxyChainSkipName()
        Deprecated. (2.3.0) Replaced by getProxyExcludedDomains() and getProxyExcludedDomainsEnabled(). Note: Newer regular expression excluded domains will not be returned by this method.

public void setProxyChainSkipName(String proxyChainSkipName)

      • isUseProxyChainAuth

        public boolean isUseProxyChainAuth()
        Tells whether or not the outgoing connections should use the proxy authentication credentials set.
        Returns:
        true if outgoing connections should use the proxy authentication credentials set, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.3.0
        See Also:
        isUseProxyChain(), setUseProxyChainAuth(boolean)

      • setUseProxyChainAuth

        public void setUseProxyChainAuth(boolean useProxyChainAuth)
        Sets whether or not the outgoing connections should use the proxy authentication credentials set.

        Note: The call to this method has no effect if set to use the credentials but the credentials were not previously set.

        Parameters:
        useProxyChainAuth - true if outgoing connections should use the proxy authentication credentials set, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.3.0
        See Also:
        isUseProxyChainAuth(), setUseProxyChain(boolean), setProxyChainUserName(String), setProxyChainPassword(String), setProxyChainRealm(String)

        Returns:

        public boolean isSingleCookieRequestHeader()
        Tells whether the cookies should be set on a single "Cookie" request header or multiple "Cookie" request headers, when sending an HTTP request to the server.
        Returns:
        true if the cookies should be set on a single request header, false otherwise

        Parameters:

      • getSecurityProtocolsEnabled

        public String[] getSecurityProtocolsEnabled()
        Returns the security protocols enabled (SSL/TLS) for outgoing connections.
        Returns:
        the security protocols enabled for outgoing connections.
        Since:
        2.3.0

      • setSecurityProtocolsEnabled

        public void setSecurityProtocolsEnabled(String[] enabledProtocols)
        Sets the security protocols enabled (SSL/TLS) for outgoing connections.

        The call has no effect if the given array is null or empty.

        Parameters:
        enabledProtocols - the security protocols enabled (SSL/TLS) for outgoing connections.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if at least one of the enabledProtocols is null or empty.
        Since:
        2.3.0
